column2: occasioned him patrimonial loss, or that they were calculated to injure
Under these circumstances, the inclusion of reputational damage in the
plaint does not, by itself, transform the action into a defamation suit.
In Silva v Silva 9 it was laid down that in a case of malicious prosecution
the onus of proof is on the Plaintiff. He must prove on a preponderance
of evidence or on a balance of probabilities,
